Activity: Boot up my workstation, grab a coffee, and check emails. Skim through industry news on ArtStation and BlenderNation while the machine warms up.
Review the character concept art provided by @cart-1. Make notes on key proportions and anatomical landmarks for the main characters. @cart-1 Let me know if the main character concepts are completed.
Open Blender and create a new project. Set up the scene with basic lighting and a reference plane for scale.
Begin blocking out the primary character's form using primitive shapes (cubes, spheres, cylinders). Focus entirely on getting the overall proportions correct. This is not about details yet.
Lunch Break. Check out some speed sculpting videos on YouTube for inspiration.
Continue refining the blockout for the primary character. Use reference images of human anatomy to guide the placement of major muscle groups. Small adjustments based on the concept art.
Take a break from the primary character and start a quick blockout of the second main character. This will help to compare proportions and ensure consistency between the two.
Save the project, back it up, and write down a brief summary of today's progress. Shut down the workstation.
